moves.3. d4: so I bring up extra d4 pawn which is always good
moves.4. Nc3: don't really know what to do, so I do the knight which doesn't block anything
moves.4... c6: thinks of pinning my knight down with queen
moves.5. dxe5: I realize I can take e5 now, het takes back left or right, either queens trade or new fried liver attempt
moves.6. Qxd8+ Kxd8: so no balck castle possible anymore
moves.7. Be3: remove black bishop for castle + check
moves.8. O-O-O: though he responds well, I can still pin down white bisshop, go freely to e6 and his two knights are quite blocked, so I castle
moves.10. Na4: would like to get knight c5 before pawn b6 and rook on line a, losing black bishop for rook
moves.11. Bxb5: having the max out of this trade
moves.11... cxb5 12. Nc3 a5 13. Nd5+ Kd8 14. B: that rook becomes mine 100% sure, left or right?
moves.14... Kc8: chose Kc8, best option since he wins a move now
moves.17... Bg4: chooses to run, quite best option
moves.18... Nc6: attacking pinned down knight at f3
moves.19. h3: so let's defend him from doing that
moves.19... Bxf3: wow that's really bad ... I had better done Bb6
moves.20. gxf3 Nxa5 21. Rd3: don't exactly know how I'm going to configure my rooks...
moves.21... Nh6 22. Rc3 f5 23. f4: I think I have better chances then to promote a pawn once...
moves.23... exf4 24. e5: I leave that pawn for better position
moves.26... Nc4 27. Rb3 Nd2+ 28. Ka1: ok it's over. I'm bad at the end game...
